abstract.p: Horace Gaims letter says spy software (June 22 article) imposes on the people who use it the information that becomes their just, self-inflicted punishment

block.p: Extreme cases -- for example, when a wife's electronic snooping disclosed that her husband wished to harm her boyfriend -- can be used to sell malodorous doctrines and programs. Since I prefer to see the humorous side of situations, it occurs to me that because of spy software, our society could well evolve (devolve?) into something resembling the ''Spy Vs. Spy'' comics of Mad magazine. In general, I'd say that what most snoopers find out constitutes their just and self-inflicted punishment.
